analyzed: glang po che ba dang / rta pa dang / shing rta pa dang ldan pas dgra'i dpung pham par byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni /

analyzed: rgyal po rang gis rig par byas nas rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur ba'i cod pa na bcing bar byed do // 'od srung / de bzhin du nga'i nyan thos dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / @152b dge bsnyen ma bslab pa legs par ji ltar bcas pa la legs par bslab pa gang yin pa de dag dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / 'dul ba'i cho ga dang / spyod yul la gnas pa de dag la ni /
translated: Having known them, the king should crown them as regents and place a diadem on their heads.🔽Kāśyapa, in the same way, the Tathāgata gives to gods and humans the bliss of those of my disciples—whether they are monks,🔽nuns, laymen, or laywomen—who are well trained in the precepts, who are restrained by the vows of individual liberation,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam par grol ba'i cod pa na 'ching bar mdzad do //🔽de las gzhan pa'i rgya chen po la lhag par mos pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i che ba'i bdag nyid rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / zhi ba dang / ther zug pa 'dod pa'i sems can gang yin pa de dag la ni /

translated: The Tathāgata binds the diadem of liberation through the four noble truths to those who have defeated the māras of the aggregates, the afflictions, death, and the sons of the gods.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes theg pa chen po dbang bskur ba'i cod pan 'ching bar mdzad do //

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du khyod kyang de ring theg pa chen po'i dbang bskur ba'i cod pan bcings te sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag mang po'i spyan snga nas rnga bo che chen po'i mdo 'di 'byin par 'gyur ro //🔽de lta bas na /🔽'od srung / khyod kyis kyang da ni /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: He applied it and beat it.🔽As soon as it was applied and beaten, all those beings who were suffering from pain heard the sound for a distance of one league or two leagues.

analyzed: dpag tshad gnyis su thos nas thos pa tsam gyis sems can de dang de dag thams cad kyi zug rngu rnams dbyung bar 'gyur /

original: zug rngu rnams bsal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zug rngu rnams bsal par 'gyur ro //

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge slong yangs pa la dad pa'i yid can de'i ming thos pa'i sems can gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi zug rngu rnams 'phyung bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, all those beings who hear the name of the monk Vīradatta will have their pains of desire, anger, and ignorance extracted.

analyzed: de bas na /

analyzed: chos dang ldan pa mngon sum du byas pa de'i mthu'o //

analyzed: 'od srung ltos /

translated: What need is there to say that the three types of afflictions of sentient beings will be removed by merely hearing the name of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vastly Faithful?
